title: Erratic Podcast 122 | Jeff Rushin
description:
Ladies and gents, what a show we have for you! Next in The Erratic Podcast we are proud to introduce JEFF RUSHIN. Hailing straight from Amsterdam, he's one of the new generation artists coming out of the Dutch capital in the last decade. Former promoter, fantastic dj, and excellent producer Jeff truly knows how to communicate with the audience, both inside the booth and in the studio. One of his most lauded works to date is his 2014 mega track "Infiltrate", which catapulted him to the forefront and was played time and time again all across the globe. Last year in 2015 he released an astounding EP on Luke Slater's Mote Evolver, A Figment of His Imagination, further solidifying him as an excellent talent. In 2016 he's released in ARTS and Weekend Circuit, both works being as what's to be expected from him - poignant and exceptional. Mixes from this man come few and apart, so we are very glad to feature one of his rare and extremely superlative hours of techno. This one is most definitely a doozy - Jeff Rushin live in the mix folks. Enjoy!

title: Erratic Podcast 120 | Héctor Oaks
description:
Next on The Erratic Podcast we are happy to welcome aboard a very talented, young artist who has been on our watch-list for a while, HÉCTOR OAKS. Based in Berlin by way of Madrid, he's made quite a name for himself in the last couple of years. In 2014 he joined the KEY imprint and later became part of the Unbroken Booking agency, a established collective of friends and artists from Berlin. Hector has also released superlative works on Sonntag Morgen, Quant, and Mutewax along with a slew of spectacular remixes that have been played by superstar djs around the world. At the start of this year 2016, he founded his own imprint, OAKS, with its first release being one of his strongest works yet. Sound-wise, what is unique about Hector is his uncanny sense of producing truly evoking and outstanding pieces of timeless techno. Powerful, deep, raw and emotive his sound juxtaposes classic and soulful Detroit with Berlin's modern raw and powerful sound, meanwhile infusing his trademark of authentic and enthralling melodies. In this mix for us, he delivers a seminal session full of good old, stomping techno mixed with exquisite, varied textures. This ride is certainly one that will be remembered and relived for times to come. Héctor Oaks in the mix, folks! Enjoy.

www.unbrokenbooking.com

title: Erratic Podcast 117 | Regal
description:
For Erratic Podcast 117 we welcome a very special guest and an absolutely tremendous artist and deejay, REGAL. Originally from Italy but living in Madrid for very long, in a matter of a few years he's managed to plant himself among the top techno producers, attracting the attention of and being welcomed under the wing and labels of some of the most established and pivotal names in the industry – Dustin Zahn, Len Faki, and Nina Kraviz to name a few. He is also the founder of his own imprint, Involve Records, which just released its 10th installment by the man himself, Salie EP, exploring a lighter yet equally substantial in sound and aesthetics as those which he is known for: raw and driving, acid-filled machine-work techno. Following this fashion, his exclusive mix for us is a combination of all these eclectic sounds. The result? A truly delightful journey evoking in the listener a juxtaposed sense of sheer, dance-floor emotion with intrinsic, visceral electronics. No doubt this one is a doozy folks: Regal in the mix. Please Enjoy!

title: Erratic Podcast 115 | Anetha
description:
Smoke, strobes, darkness, bone-chilling coldness, and pulsating bass: Our next guest's style is no doubt the epitome of what it means to experience the sheer power of the raw and raging, ebullient techno genre. ANETHA is a fantastic dj who caught our attention not too long ago and ever since then we've been very eager in awarding her the spotlight on our podcast series. 

A resident of Blocaus in Paris, she's made quite a name for herself recently, both on the deejaying and production fronts. Her debut EP "Ophiucus" came out last year on Work Them Records, receiving massive accolades and quickly becoming sold out. Much like her dj sets, her production style is characterized by the raw and vibrant, ravey warehouse feel that is filled with so much energy and tension; and the result of each one of her works is supremely elevating. Blending the old-school with the avant-garde, her music is truly evoking and transports the listener to the times every music lover (and dancer), has had on the dancefloor -- where dreams and reality become one -- and after that moment's passed, one cannot but dwell and yearn for reliving it once more. 

Anetha's set for us does just that -- sequesters you on a journey through the deepest and rawest corners of your mind and soul... all while cursing the richest and oldest of techno catalogs. Ladies and gentlemen, this is Anetha in the mix. Please Enjoy!

www.facebook.com/Anetha-395580317184152
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/anetha
www.facebook.com/Blocausparis

description:
Ladies and gentlemen - what we are about to present to you is a podcast episode like none we've had before. It is one of those rare and unique pieces of recorded dance history that we seldom get to experience in their entirety on the dancefloor, much less have the pleasure of reliving from almost beginning to end. For Erratic Podcast 110, we are honored to showcase a whopping 7 hours from THOMAS HESSLER and VINCENT NEUMANN's back-to-back set at the infamous Distillery in Leipzig, Germany. This epic night took place a few weeks ago on Saturday, December 5, 2015 and the journey is unprecedented and extraordinary. We are extremely excited to feature this monster of a mix and hope you enjoy every hour of it as much as we do. Happy Holidays folks! ENJOY :)

title: Erratic Podcast 101 | Ontal
description:
Following up the momentous, quadrennial episode from the Erratic founders, we welcome next in the series a duo whose sound and style have no rival, ONTAL. Hailing from Serbia and composed of Boris Noiz and Darko Kolar, we are huge fans of all their works and are extremely thrilled to have them showcased in The Erratic Podcast. Their mixes come few and apart; are always layered and multi-faceted; and with each one of them they simply out-do themselves by raising the bar to unprecedented levels. Just last month, they released their debut album ‘The Topics’ (a collaboration with British duo, Dronelock), that was released on Shadow Story, the label run by the latter pair. In Ontal's mix for us, you get to sample two of the twelve cuts that make the LP, as well as 26 other tracks, loops, and bits and pieces of astounding, beautiful techno – all surgically mixed into 1 hour of abominable sound, remarkable journey. Undoubtedly, this is for the headiest of heads, the bravest of souls, the strongest of hearts. Ladies and gentleman, this is Ontal live in the mix. Enjoy!

title: Erratic Podcast 100 | Dos Lokos
description:
After 4 years of running and curating The Erratic Podcast, we have reached milestone episode 100 and, without further adieu, wanted to send a sincere Thank You to every single one of you for the continued support and keeping us one hundred episodes strong. To commemorate the occasion, we decided to feature none other than the Erratic founders themselves, DOS LOKOS, with one of their strongest pieces yet. Their contribution – a combination of shrewd, cerebral and evoking techno – showcases a deeper take and sensibility, this time cursing and traversing the unprecedented. As usual, the journey is composed of and features artists and labels they genuinely admire and support (both veterans and newcomers, established and becoming), and it presents to you a unique palette of sounds that do the quadrennial episode justice; as well as it showcases Nico and Jason’s passion towards the genre. Without further adieu, ladies and gentleman, here are the Erratic founders live in the mix for Episode 100. Please listen, share, comment and enjoy!

description:
Going back to the Netherlands for our next episode, we are very excited to welcome into The Erratic Podcast one man who has made quite a name for himself over the last few years, INVITE. Aside from being a fantastic dj with many years of experience, in 2011 he started his own podcast series called "Invite's Choice" – and since then he hasn't looked back. With over 250 episodes to date, it has become one of the most famous and leading purveyors of weekly techno out there. Recently, Tim also released his debut EP "Active Trigger" on Knotweed (Philippe Petit's label based out of France), which received massive, heart-felt support. This current year 2015 is also looking very promising for him: he is launching his own imprint, Invite's Choice, with the first release slated for the summer; and the first Invite's Choice night is taking place the first week of May at Closure in Amsterdam. tag_list: "DJ Skirt" "vinyl mix" erratic nyc uk birmingham semantica
title: Erratic Podcast 87 | DJ Skirt
description:
Born and raised in the US but now settled in the UK, we have the pleasure of welcoming one of the finest and purest techno laureates the genre has to offer, DJ SKIRT. Her approach and style are truly unique and reflective – she doesn’t just write music, but carves in time her artistic thoughts and emotions; she doesn’t just mix music, but more importantly blends and molds the rhythmic life of records, meticulously, within and between each other, sincerely. This latter feat is a reflection of her love and passion towards the purist approach of delivering her musical voyages – via vinyl, and vinyl only. No doubt, she takes great pride in all the music that she touches, and it shows. Her mixes are selective and come few and apart, each one of them having a pulse and character of its own. For us, the journey she unraveled is one of awe, depth, and breathtaking beauty. This is Skirt for the next hour. Enjoy!

description:
Next on the series, we are proud to welcome one of the Finnish techno stalwarts, SAMULI KEMPPI. He is behind the acclaimed Deep Space Helsinki radio show as well as the label, under the same name, both run and co-founded alongside Juho Kusti. For the past decade, Samuli has been releasing his take of top-notch, icy, minimalesque techno across many of the best labels (Mote, Perc, M_Rec, Komisch, Balans). For us, he contributed the entire hour of 100% hardware techno performed live at Flow Festival in Helsinki last month. The set is full of fresh material and at 132 beats-per-minute, it twists and turns pushing through layers of trippy, rhythmic techno… all arranged live. As he called it himself – "132 bpm voodoo techno." Ladies and gentlemen, this is Samuli Kemppi Live. Enjoy!

title: Erratic Podcast 81 | LoKKoTRONN
description:
Fresh back from Europe, our next episode comes from our resident, where after spending 10 days in Amsterdam and Berlin, he delivers 80 minutes of supremely mental techno. This was his first time visiting these cities and all the events and performances were, no doubt, best in class. From Trouw to Awakenings, Tresor to Berghain, everything that was said about these techno havens was true, and then some. 

This is what his aim in this episode was – to relive all the sounds and textures, creating a deep and intense journey to transport the listener to all that was experienced abroad... tension, excitement, uncertainty, ecstasy, and absolution. This is LoKKoTRONN in the mix, folks. ENJOY!

description: Oh lord, what an episode we have for you! Coming straight from the very skillful SUNIL SHARPE (based out of Dublin, Ireland) the next hour is an earful. With releases on Sheworks, Black Sun Records, and Inner Surface he is a man of many trades. He runs the Earwiggle imprint from his hometown since 2011, as well as mans-up the RTE 2FM monthly radio show providing exclusive, well-curated interviews and podcasts for the late-night owls. Outdoing himself, Sunil put together a fresh and special studio mix for us showcasing his impeccable mixing - traveling the raw, the pummeling, and the eclectic. This is techno across all flavors, and certainly not for the faint of heart. We hope you enjoy it as much as we do. This is SUNIL SHARPE in the mix, folks. ENJOY! tag_list: techno "george paar" "par recordings" dark banging cerebral underground
title: Erratic Podcast 46 | George Paar
description:
Hailing from Montevideo, Uruguay, we have a fantastic artist featured in this episode - true underground DJ, producer, and label boss, GEORGE PAAR. He is no stranger to the underground scene nor to techno, as he's been exploring and experimenting with sounds for over a decade and his tracks have been released on Gynoid, Micro.fon, Ketra, and his own Par Recordings.

Though fairly new, Par Recordings is home to an array of global talent already and its sister imprint for vinyl-only, Par Wax, has Georgio Gigli featured in its latest release "Life Is Not Dead Yet," which is included in full inside this special 90-minute mix. This collaboration is deeply personal and carries a complex and intimate message from the author himself "it's a homage to life itself...dedicated to all those individuals that continue with their lives even when struck by misfortune and grief." 

Covering several of George's own productions this podcast epitomizes what his sound, label, and overall underground endeavors solely stand for: shrewd, thought-provoking techno.

title: Erratic Podcast 38 | The Plant Worker
description: Hailing from France, episode 38 comes from a young producer who has made quite a name for himself in the last couple of years and who recently gave birth to a new moniker dedicated to the rawer, deeper, harder side of his productions, THE PLANT WORKER. He is more widely known as Alejandro Trebor, with releases across Trapez, Nachstrom, and Hidden Recordings among others, while The Plant Worker debuted last year with a fantastic and acclaimed release on Detroit’s Blank Code, Beta EP.   In this podcast, he presents us with 1-hour of straight pounding, bass-driven, no nonsense techno, showcasing his new ego and the Detroit-influence style. Navigating craftily through the industrial, the acid, and the banging he delivers flawless and surgical mixing. title: Erratic Podcast 35 | Dimi Angélis
description: For Episode 35 we present a very special, vinyl-only set from another Dutch master, DIMI ANGELIS. For the occasion, he dug deep into his record collection to put together this superb and unprecedented 80-minute mix of deep, raw, and obscure underground quality. Looking into 2013, "I plan on continue working on new stuff for A&S with Jeroen Search and release my first solo EP." There is also a special project he's been working on with Jeroen as well, yet to be disclosed at the moment but due for announcement later this year. description: For Episode 22 we are very happy to feature a special podcast mix from veteran, multifaceted, and Echocord's label boss, KENNETH CHRISTIANSEN. Hailing from Copenhagen, Denmark and with much experience in his local electronic scene, he has seen and experienced it all --working across the pivotal record shops in his city; to founding the, now world-renowned, Echocord label; to owning and managing the famed Culture Box club.
